item.title: [Game Boy] Logic Island
item.description: Logic Island Logic Island is my first homebrew game for the original Game Boy, yay! Download : https://tardigrade-nx.itch.io/logic-island Logic Island a Picross-like logic puzzle game for the original Game Boy, inspired by Nikoli’s Nurikabe. Nurikabe is one of my favorite games of all times. This is my version of it, with graphics hopefully a little more elaborate than a simple grid. The rules may not be as simple as Picross at first, but it’s worth it: once you know how to play, the game becomes very addictive, with a lot of depth and strategies to offer.

item.title: [Android] The Pawn
item.description: The Pawn The Pawn is an original puzzle game for Android, inspired by chess. You don’t need to know the rules of Chess to play, as it is quite different. Tap to move, one square at a time. Move onto another friend piece to change into it. Change into the king to win. Move onto an enemy piece to knock it out. Each piece has a different move set, indicated by arrows.

item.title: [Nintendo Switch] SlitherlinkNX
item.description: SlitherlinkNX Slitherlink is a logic puzzle game created in 1989 by Japanese publisher Nikoli, famous for creating Sudoku, among many other puzzle games. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slitherlink for more info. I discovered the game a few years ago on the Nintendo DS with ‘Puzzle Series Vol. 5: Slitherlink’, which was never released outside of Japan. It’s such a good game I grew addicted to it, just like with Picross and Nurikabe. This is my version of the game for the Nintendo Switch.

item.title: [Android] Card Games
item.description: Solitaire! A Klondike game, easy to play on a smartphone touch screen. Instead of using inaccurate drag-and-drop to select a particular card stack, just click the source pile, then the destination pile, and let the computer manage the move. Google Play Store : https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.robglu.solitaire Freecell! A Freecell game easy to play on a smartphone touch screen. Instead of using inaccurate drag-and-drop to select a particular card stack, just click the source pile, then the destination pile, and let the computer manage the move.

item.title: [PSP] AntiTetris
item.description: AntiTetris A homebrew game for PSP. AntiTetris is a visual reproduction of the Game Boy Tetris, but based on a physics engine. Lines are not implemented. The aim is to stack up as many tetrominoes as possible before they reach the top of the screen. Download: AntiTetris.zip Source: AntiTetris_src.zip Vidéo: http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x61qf5_antitetris-psp-homebrew_videogames Credits: Development: Tardigrade Graphics library: JGE++ Physics engine: Chipmunk

item.title: [Nintendo DS] Negative Space
item.description: Negative Space An original homebrew game for the Nintendo DS, based on the concept of negative space. Download: NegativeSpacev2_nds.zip / NegativeSpacev2_gba.zip Source: NegativeSpacev2_src.zip How to play: The whole game contains only two colors: black and white. The player controls two ‘blob’ characters: the white blob moves in the black space, and the black blob in the white space. That’s why, empty space for one blob represents solid ground and walls for the other.

item.title: [PSP] Game&Watch Fantasies
item.description: Game&Watch Fantasies A homebrew game for PSP. Download: GWF.zip / GWFv2.zip Source: GWFv2_src.zip Game&Watch Fantasies is a puzzle/platform game for the PSP, inspired by the Game&Watch LCD games. Rule #1: Just like in a Game&Watch, the hero moves discontinuously. Therefore, he can “teleport” through thin obstacles by simply walking or jumping. However, gravity doesn’t allow him to do so: it is impossible to go through an obstacle when falling. Rule #2: If the obstacle is too large, the hero will move until he touches it.

item.title: [Nintendo DS] Everlasting Love
item.description: Everlasting Love A homebrew game for the Nintendo DS. Everlasting Love is a combination of a 2D platformer and a rhythm game, in which you have to adjust your jumps using the music. The song is Everlasting Love from the original soundtrack of We Love Katamari. Download: Everlasting.zip / Everlasting_sc.zip / Everlasting_gba.zip How to play : The monkey can move right and left during jumps only. No walking. As soon as he touches a wall, he holds onto it until the next jump.

item.title: [Nintendo DS] Ninji & Zarbi
item.description: Ninji & Zarbi A homebrew game for the Nintendo DS. Download: Ninji_nds.zip / Ninji_gba.zip / Ninji_sc.zip Source: Ninji_0.1_src.zip At any time, the two characters Ninji (bottom screen) and Zarbi (upper screen) are located at the same place on their respective screen. You control both characters at the same time. The aim of the game is to achieve the highest score possible, by neutralizing Bullet Bills and catching the NDSes that appear on screen.

item.title: [Nintendo DS] Touch me
item.description: Touch me (I’m famous) Homebrew game for the Nintendo DS. Touch me (I’m famous) is a mix between a shooting game and a rhythm game. The song heard during the game is a sample from Sweet euphemisms by Soso. Download: TouchMe_nds.zip / TouchMe_gba.zip Source: TouchMe_0.1_src.zip How to play: Hold the DS vertically. Shoot the enemies by tapping them with the stylus, but always by the rhythm: either on the beat (indicated by the flash), or on the back beat.
